meanings.definition: The study or science of missions.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pursue a degree in missiology to learn more about missionary work.
meanings.sent2: The professor's expertise in missiology greatly contributed to the success of the mission trip.
meanings.sent3: The book on missiology was so interesting that it kept her up all night reading.
meanings.sent4: In the world of missiology, knowledge is the key that unlocks the door to effective missions.
meanings.sent5: Her passion for missiology was evident in the way she spoke about different missionary strategies.

meanings.definition: The practical application of missiological principles in missionary work.
meanings.sent1: The organization's approach to missiology involved hands-on experience in various communities.
meanings.sent2: Effective missiology requires a deep understanding of the local culture and customs.
meanings.sent3: The team's unconventional missiology approach raised a few eyebrows but yielded positive results.
meanings.sent4: In the field of missiology, adaptability is often the key to overcoming challenges in missionary work.
meanings.sent5: His dedication to missiology was evident in the way he tirelessly worked to improve the lives of those he served.
